intro: Oxydectes tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that develop into spherical, white seed heads. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Oxydectes tridentata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
